name: Fancy A Quotation Challenge? Quiz | People | 25 Questions

questions.text: Who said,'Television has brought back murder into the home - where it belongs'?
Who said,'We're gonna sell you this seat, but you're only going to use the edge of it'?
questions.explanation:
Quentin Tarantino.

	Quoted in advertising for his 'Reservoir Dogs' (1992)

questions.text: Who said,'Some of my best leading men have been horses and dogs'?
Who said,'The city is not a concrete jungle, it is a human zoo'?
Who said,'There were three of us in this marriage, so it was a bit crowded'?
Who said,'I always say, keep a diary and some day it'll keep you'?
questions.explanation:
Mae West.

	1937 film:Every Day's a Holiday.

questions.text: Who said, 'There are three things that my brother Chico is always on; a phone, a horse or a broad'?
Who said,'A bank is a place that will lend you money if you can prove that you don't need it'?
Who said,'I guess a film in which I didn't end up in bed, in the sea, or in a hot tub, would have the same appeal as a Clint Eastwood movie in which nobody got shot'?
Who said,on bisexuality,'It immediately doubles your chances for a date on Saturday night'?
Who said,'In Westerns you were permitted to kiss your horse but never your girl'?
Who said,'The really frightening thing about middle age is the knowledge that you'll grow out of it'?
Who said,'When the light goes on in the refrigerator, I do twenty minutes'?
questions.explanation:
Jerry Lewis.

	On his compulsion to perform.

questions.text: Who said,'Politics is supposed to be the second oldest profession.I have come to realize that it bears a very close resemblance to the first'?
Which English writer wrote; 'The art of biography is different from geography.Geography is about maps but biography is about chaps'?
Who said,'They love me in Japan.But unfortunately I don't want their love.I want their money'?
Who wrote, 'Marriage isn't a word... it's a sentence'?
questions.explanation:
King Vidor.

	In the 1928 film 'The Crowd'

questions.text: Who said,'I don't care what is written about me so long as it isn't true'?
Who said,'Having one child makes you a parent; having two you are a referee'?
Who said,'A woman is like a teabag - only in hot water do you realize how strong she is'?
Who said of 'The Spice Girls','The good thing about them is that you can look at them with the sound turned down'?
Who said,'Either he's dead, or my watch has stopped'?
questions.explanation:
Groucho Marx.

	The 1937 film 'A Day at the Races'

questions.text: Who said,'Death and taxes and childbirth! There's never any convenient time for any of them'?
Who said,'If this is dying, then I don't think much of it'?
questions.explanation:
Lytton Strachey.

	Biographer and essayist born in London (1880-1932).Words said on his deathbed.

questions.text: Which famous advertising slogan did Maurice Drake coin the phrase?
options: Go to work on an egg
questions.explanation:
Beanz Meanz Heinz.

	For Heinz baked beans in 1967.
